nodes.bodyText: This was necessary to make it work on March 28 before the daylight savings time changed.
I would still use dummy for local development.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,12 +8,12 @@ apiml:
         discoveryServiceUrls: https://localhost:10011/eureka/
     security:
         auth:
-            provider: dummy

nodes.bodyText: I have used that for testing and missed that while committing. Thank you
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,12 +8,12 @@ apiml:
         discoveryServiceUrls: https://localhost:10011/eureka/
     security:
         auth:
-            provider: dummy

@@ -8,12 +8,12 @@ apiml:
         discoveryServiceUrls: https://localhost:10011/eureka/
     security:
         auth:
-            provider: dummy
+            provider: zosmf
             zosmfServiceId: zosmf  # Replace me with the correct z/OSMF service id
             passTicket:
                 timeout: 360 # [s] - default timeout to expire (z/OS has 10 mins as default)
         ssl:
-            verifySslCertificatesOfServices: true

@@ -8,12 +8,12 @@ apiml:
         discoveryServiceUrls: https://localhost:10011/eureka/
     security:
         auth:
-            provider: dummy
+            provider: zosmf
             zosmfServiceId: zosmf  # Replace me with the correct z/OSMF service id
             passTicket:
                 timeout: 360 # [s] - default timeout to expire (z/OS has 10 mins as default)
         ssl:
-            verifySslCertificatesOfServices: true

@@ -8,12 +8,12 @@ apiml:
         discoveryServiceUrls: https://localhost:10011/eureka/
     security:
         auth:
-            provider: dummy
+            provider: zosmf
             zosmfServiceId: zosmf  # Replace me with the correct z/OSMF service id
             passTicket:
                 timeout: 360 # [s] - default timeout to expire (z/OS has 10 mins as default)
         ssl:
-            verifySslCertificatesOfServices: true

nodes.bodyText: Is it reasonable expectation that the V1 will be always supported?
The functionality that this code expects in z/OSMF is planned to be supported forever.
